website_summaries.verdict: The biggest of the backpacks on our list makes it a good choice for school or adventure.
pros: Features a multi-compartment design and a laptop sleeve that fits most 17-inch laptops for school as well as tuck away waist belt and rain cover for adventures
cons: Less durable than some of the other models on our list

customer_reviews.title: I'm not in love with it
customer_reviews.text: I'm not in love with it. Pros: It's durable and very comfortable, even when filled with heavy textbooks- the straps are pretty amazing.. It can handle a bit of rain, even without using the rain cover. Why I don't like it: the zippers stick often- it's quite frustrating a lot of the time. The shape of it is strangely more wide than deep and that limits the number of books you can fit into it. In fact, for how large it is, it seems like it would hold more, but no. overall? It's a good bag, esp for the price, but I don't know if I'd buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: Dmeanr

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed - it's falling apart!
customer_reviews.text: Usually I LOVE this backpack - It holds a ton of stuff and has a hidden rain coat, which is very helpful when my son is waiting at his bus stop to keep his school stuff dry. My son's previous backpack (same brand and almost the same model) last from 2nd grade through 6th grade. This is why I purposefully sought this one out. Unfortunately, within 6 months one of the shoulder straps' stitching started coming off. Now it's just a matter of time before the whole thing is unattached. I was really hoping this would last at least 2 years until my son made it to high school, but it doesn't appear so. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: H. Windham

customer_reviews.title: Less than 2 months old and the stitching is loose and the zipper broke
customer_reviews.text: Overall the design of the backpack is excellent. It held everything I needed it to and the sternum strap keptit comfortable while riding my bike. I thought I found the perfect backpack for my 17 in laptop. However, after less than two months of normal use, the stitching holding the zipper in place became undone. Additionally the zipper broke. If this occurred after years of use, I would have given this pack 5 stars. However, failing after less than two months is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: whenhen

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart in a very short time. I do not recommend this one.
customer_reviews.text: The poor stitching inside causes seams to rip between compartments. You never know where your stuff is. I purchased my first one exactly like this one in 2003 and it lasted many years but the material began breaking down so I was really happy to see that High Sierra still made this model. Problem is, this one is nothing like my original one. The seams inside the backpack started coming undone right away. Openings between the different compartments are so frustrating. Actually, this backpack is falling apart from the inside out and very cheaply made with no quality control. Thanks a lot, China. Don't buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: R. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Okay, but not as nice as it used to be
customer_reviews.text: My son got this bag for school a couple years ago. This year he wanted a new one as the original one finally wore out. This new one isn't as nice as the original one he got in 2016. The fabric feels like it might crack, the straps are much stiffer (even though they are new, they aren't nearly as supply as the original one was when it was new), and the nylon straps feel like a much cheaper material than the original did. He still likes it, but it doesn't feel like it'll last as long (and the price went up a little).
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Well Organized With Great Access
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased my third High Sierra Access backpack. I've searched but haven't found another backpack that is so useful and well organized. The many pockets and compartments allow you to adapt the backpack for a variety of uses -- carrying a laptop or a hydration pack, separate places to hold keys, phone, checkbook and pens, etc. This one has a waist strap, which is very helpful in distributing the load when hiking. The newer version apparently lacks a waist strap, which would make it a non-starter for me. If these packs were put together with stronger zippers and stitching I would have added an additional star. They tend to last about three years with daily use.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic sturdy backpack
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this backpack! I purchased it for my son who was moving into his high school years. Because he does not have the opportunity to visit his locker during his school day he needs to carry everything that he needs for the day with him all day. This backpack easily fits all of his notebooks, binders, school books, music, water, pens, pencils, and anything else you could think of including is Chromebook. Past reviews have spoken about zippers that did not work well, my son has absolutely not found this to be the case. He is hard on most things especially backpacks and this backpack has absolutely stood up to his abuse.
customer_reviews.author: J.O.

customer_reviews.title: Overall I like this backpack
customer_reviews.text: Overall I like this backpack. I really like the quick access top zipper for getting out my laptop. This feature make airport security much easier. The zippers are all covered with a flap of fabric for waterproofing purposes, which often snags and makes it difficult to close in one motion. The headphone and music player top front pouch is upside down in a U shape. If you do not close this pouch completely all the contents fall out. I also really like the waterproof rain cover, I just wish it wasn't so bright yellow.
customer_reviews.author: katie

customer_reviews.title: Very nice pack. Will not fit 17.5” laptops!
customer_reviews.text: Love High Sierra back packs. Plenty of pockets and zippers. I bought because I got a bigger laptop and my old one was too small. Laptop is 17.5”, this does not fit in the tech space of the back pack. I debated on returning it but I looked for so long and was not happy with others that I saw. My laptop will fit in the main compartment of the backpack, just not in the padded space that is provided, so I chose to keep the backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Description of product not accurate
customer_reviews.text: Updated because I'm an idiot and missed that the rain cover was in a pocket on the bottom of this model. Sigh. I would have given this 5 stars because I love my old pack (different model) but the website description differed from what I received. Granted, I did get the pictured backpack and it will do the job fine, but the main reason I purchased THIS backpack was the description indicated it would include a rain cover. There was no rain cover and sadly, here in Seattle that means I have to carry an umbrella to keep the pack and my belongings dry. I loathe having the carry an umbrella. :(
customer_reviews.author: Miz Em

customer_reviews.title: 6 year review
customer_reviews.text: The backpack has lasted for almost 6 years. It has finally started fraying at the bottom. I have used the backpack for hiking, daily usage on motorcycle. heavy loads [trying to take as much on a backpack on a plane ]. It has almost three major compartments and can hold a bunch of stuff. I havent figured some of the straps but I am sure it is useful. Also has a headphone outlet thingy that I noticed only a couple of years ago. Great value for about 50 bucks [2014 price]
customer_reviews.author: DN

customer_reviews.title: I loved it. It had everything one needs in a ...
customer_reviews.text: I loved it. It had everything one needs in a backpack for everyday use: lots of space, tech spot, waterproof rain cover, and looks good. But it was too large for my size (5.2 ft) and I'm skinny so it looked really odd on me, plus the straps were uncomfortable on my tiny shoulders. So I had to return it, got my refund though. I wish it would come in like a petit size as I love the brand and I have only been using High Sierra for two years now.
customer_reviews.author: Anu

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this commodious bag
customer_reviews.text: I got this backpack for my then-12 year old son because it had the largest capacity of any we had looked at. The bag has a large main pocket, and the smaller areas are well proportioned and useful. He stubbornly put all his books in the largest compartment rather than splitting them in two, and the zipper began separating. However, their customer service was amazing - they asked which bag he wanted to replace it, and the replacement arrived within two days. Now he has learned to distribute his books more evenly!
customer_reviews.author: NOLA_mom

customer_reviews.title: Love the waterproof poncho
customer_reviews.text: I bought this same backpack for my son his freshman year of high school. I recently purchased this again for him he’s in his sophomore year of college. He loves this backpack. Plenty space for a laptop and books and he can’t live without the water proof poncho that surrounds the bag and tucks away nicely. I will buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Julia O. Yount

customer_reviews.title: Good for organization, bad for your clothes
customer_reviews.text: I bought this backpack for college because I needed one with a laptop compartment. Backpack is decently sturdy and I like that it has lots of compartments to organize my stuff. HOWEVER: 1) the stitching on the straps started to come loose after only a month's use, 2) the straps rubbed on my arms a bit uncomfortably when wearing a tank top, and 3) THE AIR MESH BACKING RUINED MY CLOTHES. I have ruined the backs of multiple sweaters and cotton/polyester shirts because the backpack rubs on them and makes them pile. I believe this is a flaw not with just this backpack but with the air mesh material in general, so try to avoid it if you can!
customer_reviews.author: Claire K

customer_reviews.title: I liked the bag a lot
customer_reviews.text: I liked the bag a lot, but after 4 years of everyday use for college, it just started falling apart. Part of this I think was through use error. If you pack this bag heavy like I did with textbooks and a laptop, you need to use the little straps that pull the backpack together, otherwise too much weight will pull on the top part of the bag, and the stress will eventually rip the top pocket from the seams. It is a nice bag though. So long as you don't carry around a ton of weight every day, it should last you many years.
customer_reviews.author: Connor

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bag given the price
customer_reviews.text: I like this bag especially for the price, very large which is why I bought it and lots of nice compartments. It is 1/3 the price of my last NF backpack. It is not exactly the highest quality - waistband is just a slim nylon strap, the zippers are kind of cheap and while I like the rain flaps over the zippers they make it hard to close the zippers - the flaps are in the way. Phone case fits a 5S but may not fit larger phones. It has a nylon raincover. But again - for the price it seems like a really good value.
customer_reviews.author: sadsack

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack!
customer_reviews.text: I'm currently a junior in high school and I've been using this backpack since freshman year. It looks the exact same as the day I bought it. It hasn't torn in any places at all and I would definitely recommend it for a student that carries a lot of textbooks or binders. It is also very comfortable !!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice backpack, very roomy
customer_reviews.text: Nice backpack, very roomy. Comfortable to carry, seems durable. Has plenty of pockets and water-bottle holder is large enough for 2-liter water bottle. Downsides: Zippers get stuck very easily, don't work very well. Waist straps aren't detachable, although they can be tucked away where they only occasionally fall out. Overall pretty nice but for 20 bucks more a Swiss Gear would be better
customer_reviews.author: Noah

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these for college and it held up great. Just bought each of my kids one- they love them! *UPDATE* Going to finally retire these after 3 years of use. Stitching did loosen and I sewed them back together several places so they would last longer. These backpacks have put up with extreme dropping, tugging and swinging by my boys (daughter's is still in great shape). Unfortunately it's "not cool" to use a locker so all their books were lugged back and forth EVERY SINGLE DAY! This meant extra wear and tear and weight. Highly recommend these backpacks as I definitely got my moneys worth out of them.
customer_reviews.author: carey G

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable Value
customer_reviews.text: I have owned High Sierra practically my whole life. From a backpack for work, to school for my kids, you just can't beat the quality or the price. It's amazing how well they hold up and the support directly from the company is amazing if you ever run into an issue with the bag. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Shuber

customer_reviews.title: 6 years later
customer_reviews.text: I've had this backpack all through college and up until now and still use it for hiking, traveling, and work. I love this thing. It's still well put together. Some things are fraying but that's okay after this time and all it has been through. I'll tell you if you want a great backpack buy this. Also fun fact for about 3 years I didn't know it had a rain cover that is in the bottom. Only until the Velcro broke did I find that out haha but it made it even better!
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Salinas

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome pack!
customer_reviews.text: Oh wow! This is possibly the best pack I've owned! Roomy, good looking, affordable, tough (so far), zesty, spicy, sexy, and comfortable, this pack does the job. It fits all sizes of laptops. I know this because I have small laptops as well as the largest ones. As a matter of fact you can put a large, a medium, and a small laptop, in there! With all those laptops, you can also easily fit tablets, phones, books (I carry sketchbooks with a few drawing implements) and other fiddly bits! It even comes with a rain cover. How about that? A rain cover! They've thought of everything and I will definitely buy more High Sierra shwag.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Deadly

customer_reviews.title: Lasted a little over a year
customer_reviews.text: Bought it a little over a year ago...Aug 2016-Oct 2017. Stitching on shoulder strap has started to come apart over the elastic shock absorber. Has come apart on both sides and is pretty much unusable at this poInt. Expected it to last longer, but not forever. Good while it lasted hence 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: JoeM

customer_reviews.title: I really like
customer_reviews.text: this is the second one I bought, same model just changed the color, one for me, the other to my son, it is nice in all aspects, spacious but not too large to carry, full of compartments, beautiful and with a plus, it has a rain cover hidden at the botton that is really useful.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio Jurgensen

customer_reviews.title: Bag holds up well.
customer_reviews.text: Still using after about two years, the bag is very sturdy and durable. The bag is also extremely spacious. I fit all my books for school plus other extra items I would need. The rain cover that comes from the bottom is extremely useful, while the bag itself has decent water resistance.
customer_reviews.author: Jhordan

customer_reviews.title: It is a cheap quality not the real brand
customer_reviews.text: I bought this end of August 2019 on Amazon. I bought the same brand at Costco and my kids used it for 4 years and it was still in great condition and I gave it away. This Amazon August purchase only being used less than 5 months and the zipper broke. Even though it is the same company this is a cheap, defective product. My child is a careful kid. I recommend please don’t buy this brand on Amazon. It is a piece of junk. Maybe this is a duplicate not the real brand. 5 months and the zipper broke
customer_reviews.author: Nalin Perera

customer_reviews.title: I can fit everything I need and then some!
customer_reviews.text: Love this backpack! This is my second High Sierra backpack and they are such good quality comparable to more expensive brands. I use this as an adult backpack and have gotten so many compliments. I especially love the rain cover, although I do wish it weren’t bright yellow. This backpack has so many pockets and compartments, I can fit everything I need and then some!
customer_reviews.author: Delilah Gamble

customer_reviews.title: great backpack for this IT professional woman
customer_reviews.text: Needed a backpack for work for my laptop as well as my insulated lunch bag (which is not tiny) abd sundries. Finally found it in this. Had to take a pair of scissors and cut out a middle nylon divider panel, but that was a breeze. I'm a middle-aged female IT professional and I've tried other things that are more fashionable but in the end went back to a backpack because it really is the best tool for the job - and this one has been serving me very well.
customer_reviews.author: ecolorado

customer_reviews.title: Broken zipper
customer_reviews.text: The backpack has plenty of storage for a 15" computer, tablet, phone,all chargers and space to spare for books or clothes for a weekend trip. it has an included rain cover in the base that can be extended over the backpack when it is raining. The straps are comfortable and there is a belly strap as well if required. I would prefer 2 water bottle holders on this backpack and the 3 star rating is for the main compartment zipper that broke after 3 months use.
customer_reviews.author: ECS65

customer_reviews.title: Durable and spacious
customer_reviews.text: This backpack is very spacious, it can fit an XBox console! It holds up well to everyday use and wear. This is the second time that I purchased this backpack. The first time I bought this backpack was 4 or 5 years ago. My son used it everyday in middle school and high school. It has finally started to show some wear on the straps and I bought him the same backpack again. He is very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Yolanda

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack and price!
customer_reviews.text: I love this backpack for its room, room, room! So many compartments to store everything you need. I live out of my backpack, so it's important to me to have plenty of compartments. Plus, this fits my 17" laptop with ease! There are 2 things I don't like: the front zipper is narrower on the new models. This means it's hard to fit your hand in the very front pocket (that's where I like to keep my keys and other stuff). Secondly, the zippers seem to catch and stick, so make sure you use both hands to open and close. Even with those cons, I still love this backpack. They last for years and they are all I will own.
customer_reviews.author: Todd B.

customer_reviews.title: Seems durable, I only use it as a carry ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems durable, I only use it as a carry on when I take my motorcycle to the airport. The breast strap came off a few times, took some finagling to get it back on the first time -- as long as you don't pull it at an angle, it isn't a problem (to put it back on, start at an angle, persistence pays off, no functionality was lost)
customer_reviews.author: ChibiNyra

customer_reviews.title: Good roomy backpack- bad zippers
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a deployment backpack and I am overall happy with it. My main complaint would be the zippers, which get caught a lot- zipping shouldn't be so complicated. Pros: lots of pockets; laptop area/padding; can hold a lot; straps are comfortable Cons: too many straps; zipper is finicky (all of them); dont love the pattern- wish it was straight black
customer_reviews.author: Natasha Kormanik

customer_reviews.title: It seems the quality has taken a turn for the worse from several years ago when i first bought this ...
customer_reviews.text: The zippers seem to be not as smooth opperating as before. They feel as if theyre gonna break if im not careful with them. It seems the quality has taken a turn for the worse from several years ago when i first bought this back pack. The only good thing i can say is that it does have a lot of room and compartments.
customer_reviews.author: Po

customer_reviews.title: The zippers are sturdy and the material seems to be well constructed as ...
customer_reviews.text: This back pack was bought for use on college campus and for hiking. So far it has only been used on campus but it fits everything I need very well and has many pockets and organizational compartments. The zippers are sturdy and the material seems to be well constructed as well. The rain cover comes in handy in the rain and has kept my books and electronics dry. I will update once I use this back pack hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Oxendine

customer_reviews.title: Somebody went crazy adding compartments
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the material is very high and the size is perfect for me. My one complaint is there are just too many compartments. It is actually hard to keep track of where to put stuff and it can take a while zip and unzipping compartments to find things. Other than that nit, this is a very nice backpack and I expect it will last a very long time. Honestly I would have preferred an LL Bean backpack - the ones I always got my kids back in the day - but I can't plan that far ahead and they are ALWAYS on a months long back-order delay.
customer_reviews.author: DBK

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag but quality is subpar
customer_reviews.text: The bag itself is decent. Large enough to hold all of my books, plenty of pockets to hold all my accessories. But my one complaint would have to be the quality of the bag. I've had it less than 2 years and it is already coming apart. The seam in one of the shoulder straps has frayed so now the elastic is just hanging there. And just tonight I noticed that the liner in between the two main compartments is wearing through and there is almost a hole between the two compartments. Bottom line is that it was good while it lasted but I won't be buying another one.
customer_reviews.author: Karl P. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great Size and Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a great sized backpack for my middle schooler. Enough room to put all his books, notebooks, lunch box, etc., plus his jacket.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise it is really a great item. He had another High Sierra one that ...
customer_reviews.text: this backpack is really large which is exactly why I ordered it for my son and that is by far really great(most of standard backpacks are no way large enough for all the books the kids need nowadays). The only thing that I see could be a problem is one of the zippers is not working quite right. That is why I gave it a 4 star. Otherwise it is really a great item. He had another High Sierra one that lasted 3 years except for the inside pocket being torn(quite amazing with all the books etc). I tried throwing it away but my son retrieved it from the trash and wants to still use it.
customer_reviews.author: JRW1488

customer_reviews.title: Traveler & Hikers best friend
customer_reviews.text: I bought and used this for a trip to Haiti. I knew I needed a backpack that would hold 3-4 days of clothes, medications, camera, etc. I researched and researched and after reading reviews and watching product videos, I chose this bag. I was able to pack 4 days of clothes and every single thing I would need during my travel. It's a large bag and has the ability to hold shoes, clothes, laptop, water bottles, camera and plenty more. Lots of little pockets and clips. Would definitely recommend to any traveler. I now use it for hiking here in Utah and it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Good but not as good as the old generation product.
customer_reviews.text: It seems the new backpack design - which is very similar to the old design from years ago - is made of cheaper material in comparison. There is more padding on the old one and this newer model seems to be much more "stiff" and rigid than the backpack I replaced. I've replaced a 5+ year old version of this exact backpack with this one yesterday (Aug. 11th, 2016). Still a good option for the price. It's not a bad backpack at all. I'm just somewhat disappointed to see things not improve much over the span of 5 years. But hey, it's $40... You can't beat that. I just hope it lasts me just as long as the first model!
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: I love the carrying capacity of this thing
customer_reviews.text: Took this bag on a month-long trip traveling through Europe, and I fit everything I wanted to bring in here, even with some space to spare. I love the carrying capacity of this thing. I did a lot of walking and it was comfortable to carry, easy to access things I needed in various compartments. I use it on every trip now, and it still looks basically new and shows no signs of wear. However, it is definitely a larger backpack, so if you're looking for a pack for short trips or day trips you would probably want something smaller and lighter.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: and like 25 pens/pencils/highlighters
customer_reviews.text: this backpack is yoooooj *deep breath* Four large, hardback textbooks, two five-subject notebooks, one 12 in. laptop with charger and mouse, cell phone charger, cosmetic bag, tennis shoes, water bottle, hairbrush, TI-30X calculator, iPod Touch, cell phone, large Advil® bottle, sunscreen spray, and like 25 pens/pencils/highlighters. And I've still got way more than enough rummage room. If I filled it up anymore, it'd be almost too heavy to carry. Your back will give out before this backpack is full. Unless you're lugging hundreds of packing peanuts, I suppose.
customer_reviews.author: Stevie

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, lots of space and pockets
customer_reviews.text: Great bag, lots of space and pockets. Could have been a five stars if it hadn't beenfor the zippers. Especially the main pocket one! They have a "lip" that covers them ( I guess for rain protection?) and the darn thing is so stiff, it make using the zipper a real pain!? I've many time wanted to cut it off with scissors...and it might happen if it stays that way. I had the bag for over a month, used it 5 days a week and no changes so far (I figured it might get better with usage?)
customer_reviews.author: Cocopu 4U

customer_reviews.title: Zippers kinda suck.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy bag, rather huge, I was surprised. This was for young teen carrying books and general stuff. Zippers aren't smooth working, and the overlap actually gets in the way of zipper. My kid wanted this very much, initially was happy, but has gone back to crappy old bag. She doesn't want to use this, and after my messing around with it to give my own test, I could see why. Will be offering it in garage sale. I am giving it 2 stars b/c it is generally made well. But the zipper design needs tweaking.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Great Backpack for travelers
customer_reviews.text: I reviewed a lot of backpacks before purchasing this one. It is definately a great value. Some insights: 1) It has tons of pockets which I really appreciate as a frequent traveler. 2) The back computer zipper is located perfectly and easy to access for trips thru the airport 3) The hidden rain sleeve on the bottom is an unexpected excellent feature - especially for those trips to seattle. 4) The backpack seems to be high quality (zippers, material, etc.) I would recommend this backpack - especially for frequent fliers.
customer_reviews.author: C. Corman

customer_reviews.title: For the perfect picture hunters out there!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my retired father for christmas. All he and I can say is WOW! The space and ease of use is amazing! It is durable and roomy for all of his camera do-dads. Plus it has a thingy to hang his keys so he wont lose them while out of a hunt for the perfect picture! Best investment for my dad EVER! It never leaves his side/back.
customer_reviews.author: ParkerFun

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Worth The Money
customer_reviews.text: The backpack is very good quality and does not disappoint in its features. It has plenty of pockets to divide your belongings, the included rain cover doubles as a cushion when not in use for your laptop and tablet, and has easily adjustable straps. Currently using it to carry school books and laptop, but it can easily be used for hiking or camping if you don't want to spend a huge premium. Would recommend to anyone looking for a new backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Best choice I could find. It's exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: It's a great backpack. More than enough room for most purposes, very sturdy construction and is actually somewhat stylish. The rain cover is great, and will stay on while riding a motorcycle. Nothing got wet and the fact that it's safety yellow adds a bit of safety precaution. There are plenty of pockets to keep things organized, it's comfortable to wear and I can tell will last a really long time. Plus, it comes at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack with waterproof rain cover
customer_reviews.text: We bought this backpack for our recent trip to Disney World. It worked as a carryon on our flights and we used it everyday in the parks. It has lots of separate compartments and a padded section for a laptop or tablet. The number one reason we picked this one was for the fold out rain cover it has. It sits tucked into the bottom, when you need it you pull it out and it wraps the whole bag in a yellow water proof cover. It was so hand to be at the parks in the rain, it kept the bag dry and all of our stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Second time around
customer_reviews.text: Fits a lot of stuff. This is my second one, my first was a slightly older design of this same style and lasted me 4 years of heavy use until it started coming apart. I'd say I got my money's worth!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High quality and full of compartments
customer_reviews.text: The zippers are large and some, but not all, have flaps covering them. I would prefer all zippers covered, but I also liked the price of this bag as compared to higher end brands which include this feature. Therefore, when necessary to carry this bag in the rain, I will pull out the rain fly from the hidden pocket below. It is sturdy and full of various sized zippered pockets for peripherals & cords. It carries my 17" laptop, a Casio projector, a Bose bluetooth speaker and a bunch of cords with room to spare and one water bottle holder. I holds a bunch of stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Ol Terrier

customer_reviews.title: the quick access laptop/tablet pocket is super useful, the rain jacket is a neat feature ...
customer_reviews.text: Very spacious, the quick access laptop/tablet pocket is super useful, the rain jacket is a neat feature although I haven't actually used it much. My main complaints are it should have mesh water bottle pockets on both sides, and the chest/hip straps are extremely thin/flimsy. The last High Sierra backpack I owned was much better in that regard. Still an overall good bag, though, especially if you need something roomy.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars — still great after 20 months
customer_reviews.text: Love this backpack! Durable and huge. It is not waterproof and the included cover is cumbersome, but usable. 20 month update: Still love this backpack. I’ve put it through hard use—I bike, fly, run, and commute to school with this thing. The Velcro that holds the waterproof cover broke, but it still stays in there well enough. The bottle holder ripped a bit, but still works. I’ll attach some photos.
customer_reviews.author: JStan

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: I loved everything about it. It is similar to one I have had for more than 15 years that I have used for traveling and work. I will use this new one for many years to come as well.
customer_reviews.author: Puanani

customer_reviews.title: Largest Width and Depth of any backpack I have tried.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great back pack for high school especially when kids have to carry several books inside. The width and depth is by far the biggest that we have seen. I have bought four of these back packs for my high schoolers, and they have held up throughout the year, sometimes even lasting two years. Don't waste you time with other retailers, if you need a large backpack, this is the ONE.
customer_reviews.author: chick517

customer_reviews.title: Breaks quickly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a middle schooler that had to carry a very wide trapper keeper, a smaller binder, some folders, lunch and water bottle. Soon after buying the cloth between compartments started falling apart. After 6 months all the zippers were broken.
customer_reviews.author: steve and claire

customer_reviews.title: High quality at an affordable price
customer_reviews.text: Product came well ahead of schedule, as described. The pictures weren't able to show the fine quality of this backpack. Having a 17inch+ labtop, carrying it is problematic, I am certain this bag will hold it, a thick binder, four notebooks, textbooks, charger, pens, and any other items. A great feature is the built in "raincoat" located at the bottom. I'm excited to put this to use.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: I love this backpack
customer_reviews.text: I love this backpack. I bought it because I was looking for a large one and I am pleased that I can fit so much in it. It also has lots of individual pockets. I've had it a few months and it has held up well so far.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael V.

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed with their quality looks like the stitches just pulled away
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bag and have used it for around 2 weeks one of the first things I noticed was the main zipper would catch when I tried to close it so I went to return it. When I went to place it in the box I also noticed that the front holders were also torn. Not impressed with their quality looks like the stitches just pulled away.......
customer_reviews.author: JustTheFacts

customer_reviews.title: So far better than the rest
customer_reviews.text: My poor daughter looks like she is going to be pulled over like a turtle on her back but the backpack itself is holding up nicely to all of the weight. She is in High school and usually by this time of year her backpacks are already showing signs of wear and tear. This one gives me hope it may last to next year when she is off to collage.
customer_reviews.author: Daydreamer

customer_reviews.title: Great backpact, good size for carry on
customer_reviews.text: Great comfortable backpack. Like the insert for laptop, dont need extra cover. Looks durable, high sierra backpacks usualy are.
customer_reviews.author: KJCO

customer_reviews.title: Great Costumer Service
customer_reviews.text: Originally, I would have rated this backpack low because my zipper broke about a month after I got it. When I tried to return it through Amazon, they said it was 1-2 days past the 30 day time period. I contacted High Sierra and told them about the problem, they didn't even require me to send the bag in, just emailed them pictures. About a week later, I received the a new back pack. High Sierra has great, hassle free costumer service. The bag was lots of space, plenty for 5 binders and a textbook in high school. It seems very well made, however, my only complaint is the zippers. They can be a little tricky to open some times.
customer_reviews.author: Liz D'Arcy

customer_reviews.title: Cheap zippers
customer_reviews.text: The zipper for the top area is sticking and comes off track easily. I gave it to my fiancé for his birthday and his first time using it was very frustrating. Update: we ended up returning the backpack. The zippers kept coming off track and got to the point they were mismatched and not zipping closed.
customer_reviews.author: Asileven

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Backpack
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this backpack for about 8 weeks now and have zero regrets. I've had that thing so cram-packed full of junk I was worried it would just explode. In fact, the 1st time I filled it up and slung it around to my back, I honestly think I heard a few stitches pop. I thought, oh jeez, here we go. Nope, it just must have been stretching out or something, because it has performed flawlessly. It has a tremendous amount of space, lots of places to organize your stuff, and is super comfortable to wear. I expect this backpack to last me several years, and will definitely purchase another High Sierra in the future.
customer_reviews.author: NE14AJ

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag in the Deep Purple color to use for college. I have a ton of textbooks, a huge binder, and a laptop that the backpack I had been using could not hold, so I went on the search for a larger bag. I found this one, bought it, and I couldn't be happier with it! It can hold my 15.6" laptop, all my textbooks, and my binder with ease! The suspension system on the straps is amazing and makes the bag feel lighter than it is. It is very sturdy and I can definitely see it lasting for years. I love it and am very happy with my purchase of this backpack!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Bailey

customer_reviews.title: the rain pouch is awesome. My only issue is with the zipper for ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this backpack because I wanted something that I can use for day hikes as well as bring to work. I am able to store my gym clothing, water bottle, laptop, lunch, and umbrella all in separate compartments. In addition, the rain pouch is awesome. My only issue is with the zipper for one of the compartments. It's very difficult to zip when holding by the handle because it folds an the zippers don't line up. Not an issue when placed on a flat surface.
customer_reviews.author: Krompir

customer_reviews.title: Zippers failed quickly
customer_reviews.text: I am a law student so I have large textbooks, and needed a large backpack. With that being said, I never put more than one book in my bag at a time for fear of damaging the backpack. Yet after about 4 months one of the two main zippers gave out. A few months later, the other did as well, preventing me from closing the backpack at all. Reliability is the most important thing I need from my backpacks because I don't have time to worry about them, and I will not be getting another one of these backpacks due to a lack of reliability.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Backpack!!
customer_reviews.text: When my son's backpack fell apart during his junior year in college, I searched high and low for a new one. I wanted to get another Adidas bag, which held up for several years, but model had been discontinued and I couldn't find another that was comparable. In addition, prices were quite high. I then found this one on Amazon. It fit all the requirements; many ample sized compartments, lap-top sleeve, good- quality zippers, gorgeous in person...and best of all the price was right. Really an incredible value. Don't hesitate.
customer_reviews.author: 4violet

customer_reviews.title: A Large Bag for those needing lots of space
customer_reviews.text: First of all this is a LARGE bag- so if you are looking for something small, perhaps just for a day trip or so or maybe to squeeze under your airplane seat, this is probably not the bag for you. The design seems adequate and the styling is nice, so no complaints there. The handles seem like they would last a long time, unlike some of the cheaper off brand bags you see in the discount stores. If this bag was smaller, I would keep it but much bigger than I anticipated.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: bought this 3 years ago in 2013. still using ...
customer_reviews.text: bought this 3 years ago in 2013. still using it and it is going strong. Backpack is straight bulky so keep that in mind. My backpack has no problems with it. After so much use, the straps be coming apart but thats after 3 years yo
customer_reviews.author: sk

customer_reviews.title: Huge
customer_reviews.text: I really like this pack. There are none of those ultra flat pockets that nothing fits in. It really is big. Believe the women who have trouble with it being too wide. I am a woman with big shoulders and I am happy with it but I don't really care personally if it is wide. It is really extremely wide for a day pack. Also the laptop hole barely fits my 15'' as well as other reviewers. Don't buy for 17''. I am really happy with it for my purposes - packing teaching supplies and laptop and lunches and water bottles all at the same time on public transit.
customer_reviews.author: Arie Farnam

customer_reviews.title: 5 years of high school text books great. The only reason for replacing the last one ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my high school sophomore. Before, he had a High Sierra backpack for 3 years, and it held up well. Some stitching on the straps had to be resewn but in general, it held up well. I bought the same brand because I thought it would be well made. Wrong. After 3 months, the stitching between the large zipper and the bag came apart. The last bag had withstood 1.5 years of high school text books great. The only reason for replacing the last one was because of ink stains and zipper breaks.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Versatile pack that can stand up to abuse
customer_reviews.text: This pack is used at an outside job and is packed full everday. It's roomy, has outside straps for holding a rain jacket and its tough.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina

customer_reviews.title: great, comfort  back pack at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I wore out my first one. It carried everything I needed and was comfortable so I bought this, my second one, backpack. I carry a 15.? Laptop, a 10" galaxy tab pro and a few books along with all my charger cords, sunglasses case and a water bottle with room to spare. And it all stays dry when raining with the inconspicuously stored rain cover. My last one lasted 2 years of undergrad and 2 years of law school. Only need this one to last 6 more months. No doubt it will. Great back pack at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: J.A.K.

customer_reviews.title: Great Backpack for Riding
customer_reviews.text: This backpack has exceeding my expectations. It is very comfortable while riding a motorcycle or bicycle thanks to the extra back padding which also helps keep the back cool while riding. There are lots of compartments to store various items. The only thing I would change about this bag is for one of two large compartments to be a little larger to allow the storage of larger items without adjusting expansion straps but after expanding these straps the large items I have need to storage did fit. The rain cover is a added bonus that is something beneficial for rider but I have not had to pleasure of trying out yet.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Used all through college and to conventions for years. Never faded or worn. Always packed full. Nice thick laptop compartment for laptop protection.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Just received this item, was very surprised, Extremely durable, very well constructed. Loved that it has 2 straps that come around to front to hook so bag doesn't feel as heavy, as I have nerve damage in my shoulders and was still able to wear. Very roomy, has a small compartment holds the bag to make waterproof. Also room for laptop, tablet, and smart phone.
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: This is a roomy and very well made backpack. My 7th grader brings home tons of stuff and has put this backpack through wear and tear and it has held up amazingly!! I highly recommend it. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack
customer_reviews.text: I love this backpack. I am a nurse and I carry everything in this for both work and personal. It has held up very well. If I were to say any negatives it would be that much shoulders are a little too narrow to use comfortably as a backpack on both shoulders. There is a ton of room and it fits a 17in laptop in the back. Buy this!
customer_reviews.author: topaz270

customer_reviews.title: best high schooler back pack EVER
customer_reviews.text: best high schooler back pack EVER!! Lots of room without being bulky and very sturdy! My kid can fit all books and XC gear no problem! Loys of nifty bells and whistles which are all useful- we highly recommend this pack!
customer_reviews.author: natasha

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money! Deep pockets!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for travel. No need for an additional laptop case. I travel quite often and can fit everything that I need in all of the pockets. Deep enough to fit multiple books or magazines, accordion folders for work, plus my laptop and my clutch purse as well as my oversized wallet, iPod and tablet! My favorite part of the bag is the waterproof attached rain cover. This is the best price I've found around. Have seen similar and almost identical bags at other places for $150+. Love it so much I bought my mother one, too!
customer_reviews.author: Pam C.

customer_reviews.title: Big backpack.  Low price.  zippers could be smoother.
customer_reviews.text: I am a fan of this brand. This is the big backpack. It has lower quality zippers than my previous smaller one. This is the only disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Murphy-Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Super sturdy and comfortable with the padded straps
customer_reviews.text: This bag is the shiznit! Super sturdy and comfortable with the padded straps, so you can let it ride on your shoulders in the usual backpack form. I love the fact I can fit my giant anatomy and physiology book along with my binder and laptop AND walk across the campus feeling like I need to stop for water and/or switch arms. There are so many cool compartments too, so I can organize quite well! This bag is amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Jdizzlefoshizzle

customer_reviews.title: There’s better out there...
customer_reviews.text: Great book bag. Have always had great experience with the brand. However, this bag ripped at the top where the zipper and strap meet. I am a teacher, so I do carry items daily.. Probably would not purchase from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: AP

customer_reviews.title: awesome for college
customer_reviews.text: Great backpack for using at school. the laptop sleeve fits my 15.6 hp in there perfect. there are also pockets (I use at least) for folders and the current motortrend to read in class. Plenty of room in the other main compartment, enough for 4 textbooks and a 1 inch binder. The sunglasses pouch is nice but rather harsh on the lenses. The front pockets are large enough to fit my TI-84 calculator along with numerous pens and pencils, as well as notecards and anything else a student needs. even has a secret side pocket for easy grab without removing the bag from your shoulder. well worth the 40 i spent
customer_reviews.author: Caleb S.

customer_reviews.title: Design and quality could be better
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has used this for about five months now and the zippers already split about half the time. Even though it's the largest size I could find, she struggles to fit all her required school stuff in it and it's very awkward to get bulky binders and books in and out.
customer_reviews.author: Pawprints

customer_reviews.title: My second one, this one has defective zippers
customer_reviews.text: The zippers on this are unusable. They wouldn't zip completely, in that after being zipped, the "teeth" of the zipper wouldn't fasten. It just got worse, and now all the major zippers are unusable. I'm so worried about my stuff just falling out on the street that I have to get a new one. btw, the exact model of this that I had before lasted for almost 2 years before the zippers fell apart. The previous pack I would have given 5 stars; that's why I ordered another one.
customer_reviews.author: T. Wayne

customer_reviews.title: This has many excellent features and design elements
customer_reviews.text: This has many excellent features and design elements, but it's junk. Several zippers didn't reliably work from day one and the sternum strap broke the first time I tried to adjust it. Replaced in no time at all with something more reliable (and more expensive). It's too bad, as I wanted to like this.
customer_reviews.author: M. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality-Ripped apart after less than 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 9th grader, who used it for less than 4 months , then it started to rip. Nylon net bottle holder started having holes, then secondary compartment stitching gave way too. Will contact customer service but based on other reviews, I don’t expect much from them. Will not buy again. Do Not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Ahp_alma

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase for college!
customer_reviews.text: This backpack has been a lifesaver! I purchased it for college and it fits everything I need. I also love the waterproof tarp-like cover at the bottom, which can easily cover almost the entire backpack while walking around. The cover has definitely saved my stuff during those days when I had class and did not expect rain. All in all it works extremely well.
customer_reviews.author: Harold B.

customer_reviews.title: Fits everything.
customer_reviews.text: Great bag. It fits everything I need for school every day. Plenty of room for everything. I also really like that it has a rain fly even though I have not had to use it yet. I just like that it is there in case as I walk to school.
customer_reviews.author: K. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great build quality.
customer_reviews.text: This backpack has enough space for everything I need, has no problem loading my laptop and a couple days worth of clothes for small trips. The zippers and the pulltabs and even the carabiner seem to be really robust and I have no fears that this will last. I've had it for 4 months now and it shows zero signs of wear and tear. I'm very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes simpler is better
customer_reviews.text: With so much going on with this backpack it is little wonder that a zipper sticks from time to time. I've only had it for a month but I'm preparing for something to break.
customer_reviews.author: ben howe

customer_reviews.title: Good bag, poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: This bag has generally served me well, with a nice variety of compartments and pockets. The straps for tightening the sides are nice, and the waist strap can be tucked away. Note that the bag is too big to fit under many plane seats, though. I recently had some damage to the bag that rendered it inoperable. Customer service has been totally unresponsive. I'll probably just have to buy a new bag to replace it, but I no longer trust High Sierra due to this experience. Update: Eventually received a replacement a couple months later, so increasing from 3 to 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Mike K

customer_reviews.title: great size
customer_reviews.text: This backpack is a great size for my high schooler. There's room for all the binders, books and lunch too. Some minor issues with stitching in a couple of spots, but otherwise very heavy duty and stands up to the wear and tear of being used by a teenage boy.
customer_reviews.author: pj proff

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Fits my giant 17" laptop like a boss. Super sturdy and i love it, but i did have a little hiccup with the stitching on the zipper. The zipper is good to go but where it is sewed to the main body came apart when i had it fully loaded up. No worries, i took a stapler to it and its all good again. Yeah i know that sounds like it may be shoddy build quality and maybe a bit of reinforced stitching is due but this bag is a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew P.

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING BACKPACK
customer_reviews.text: One thing that has always been a pet peeve when it comes to backpacks is their framing. Most back packs are floppy and have no shape, but this bag has amazing high suspension straps, support on the back and is very protective of the contents inside. The laptop pouch inside is great, the many versatile zipper pouches and water resistant yellow cover has come in handy. Worth every penny and allows me to carry all my school textbooks around comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: going to 14 different countries with it and taking it with my EVERYDAY to work the last two years I will say that this has been the best backpack I have ever owned in my life
customer_reviews.text: I got this in 2012. It is time to be replaced. After using this in college everyday with way too many books, going to 14 different countries with it and taking it with my EVERYDAY to work the last two years I will say that this has been the best backpack I have ever owned in my life. I have had 3 or 4 other backpacks between 2012 up until now and none of them have last. I am going to buy an other just like it. If anything can last the way that one did its worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Luke Kennedy

product_meta.title: High Sierra Access Laptop Backpack
product_meta.description: The High Sierra Access backpack is ideal for people that require a lot of organization and storage space. This is a large capacity pack that is designed for maximum utility and comfort. Shoulder straps with suspension, adjustable side compression straps and waist belt are included to make carrying heavy loads feel lighter by distributing the weight of the gear around your entire torso. The Access offers multiple, large compartments with a convenient side-access pocket and premium multi-pocket organizer with a removable key fob. Keep all of your digital gear safe with a fully padded laptop sleeve, which holds most 17-inch laptops. A dedicated tablet sleeve and other small compartments are designed to keep your personal electronics easily within reach.
feature_bullets: Large main compartments and multiple pockets allow you to keep all of your gear secure and organized
A fully padded CushionZone laptop compartment accommodates most 17-inch models. A dedicated TechSpot sleeve provides an ideal space for your tablet
The rain cover is stored in a hidden compartment at the bottom of the bag. It is perfect for keep your contents dry and help keep the bag clean when checked during air travel
The Suspension System provides relief when carrying heavier loads. It does so by dampening the shock of weight transfer while transporting your gear
The Suspension System provides relief when carrying heavier loads. It does so by dampening the shock of weight transfer while transporting your gear
Moisture wicking Vapel mesh material and deep air channels create maximum airflow between your back and the pack
